level.text: Factors which may be relevant in determining whether or not a decedent was a resident or nonresident for purposes of the Act include, by way of illustration and not by way of limitation, the following:
The intent of decedent to establish a domicile as evidenced by writings of decedent, such as a will;
The location and nature of a permanent dwelling maintained by decedent;
The purpose of the decedent’s presence in the District;
Commitments and acts indicating domicile, including the following:
Place of filing income tax returns;
The situs of a decedent’s assets, major business interests or sources of livelihood;
Participation in fraternal, religious and social organizations; and
The amount of time spent by the decedent in various locales.
When a claim is made that the residence of the decedent was outside the District, the taxpayer shall have the burden of showing nonresidence.
